info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 13 at 6:42PM EDT until July 13 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is ongoing or expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following counties, Cabarrus, Gaston, Mecklenburg and Union NC. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 641 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gastonia, Uptown Charlotte, Monroe, Central Charlotte, South Charlotte, East Charlotte, Southwest Charlotte, Northwest Charlotte, Matthews, Mint Hill, Indian Trail, Mt Holly, Weddington, Belmont, Stallings, Unionville, Pineville, Cramerton, Lake Park and Lowell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
